column4: lemme run something by y'all: there's the adm group for users created as admins, and the users group (assumedly) for those who are not in adm.  however, there's no group that encompasses both (e.g. for allowing all users on a system access to a folder).  it seems like that should be something that happens automatically.  am i missing something or could i file a feature request for that?
I would think that if normal users can access it, than admins can also access it.
could you check your user settings?
sure, what am I looking for?
a group that encompasses the members of users and adm, i guess.  or something else that's suitable.
users encompasses "all users," and I am in there, and I'm also in admin, so yeah...
hmm... how could i have messed that up?  i checked all available boxes when adding users.  did you do a fresh install with breezy?
nope. I installed hoary, then dist-upgraded. I didn't do anything for user setup, just what it asked me to do when I installed it...
same here with breezy (just yesterday), with the exception of adding four other users for the rest of my family.
hmm, it looks to me like the default settings for "add user" should be fine.
i'll try one now...
they just need to be in default group 'user'.
yes, but what in the user GUI tool manages that assignment?
is it the "user profile" on the advanced tab?
the 'advanced' tab in the user profile editor has that...
i set all to the administrator profile; shouldn't that still assign them to the users group?
no, but being admins, they should have access to all user stuff.
unless you assign something to the users group.
you can sudo stuff to death, but that doesn't seem the point here.
I dunno then...
i would think that the users group would be everyone and the adm would only be those who have the administrator profile.  does that make sense to you?
I dunno. I would think it's the other way around, that admin is user privaleges and then some, but I don't know much about user privalages and whatnot.
we're saying the same thing. ^_^ thanks for the help; i'll file a bug.
oh, :P ok...
